titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: John Dunning devoted the last twenty-five years of his life to obtaining and making available to the public top quality photographs of as many of the bird species of South America as he could find. About 30,000 of his slides are now on deposit with Visual Resources for Ornithology (VIREO), a branch of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence with staff members at the Academy, particularly related to VIREO; correspondence related to various book projects; correspondence related to identification of birds in slides; travel arrangements; requests for slides and articles; correspondence with environmental groups, including the World Wildlife Fund and the Audubon Society; and notebooks, 1965-1985 (#65-#1889), that include information on location, bird descriptions, photographic details, and equipment used.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Visual Resources for Ornithology records.
